snippet: With a pneumatic tube system on Roosevelt Island, there are no big trucks or smelly piles on the streets. Once residents dump their trash down chutes, a vacuum pulls it through underground tubes.
abstract: The Appraisal column; Roosevelt Island's Automatic Vacuum Assisted Collections System, known as Avacs, features pneumatic tubes buried in ground that silently suck garbage from buildings; residents say biggest advantage to using system is overall cleanliness.
lead_paragraph: With a pneumatic tube system on Roosevelt Island, there are no big trucks or smelly piles on the streets. Once residents dump their trash down chutes, a vacuum pulls it through underground tubes.

headline.print_headline: Garbage Collection, With No Noise or Smell
headline.main: Garbage Collection, Without the Noise or the Smell
